title: Haäfe & Haph Logo Critique
content:
I’m working on completely fleshing out the [Haäfe & Haph](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828002634/http:/www.haafe.com/) site to launch soon, here is the logo I’m close to wrapping up. Critiques comments? I’ve been messing with this two face thing also- not sure if it should be part of the ’logo’

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828002634im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/haafe_5251.png)

 [‹ Quaker logotype critique/customizing issues](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828002634/http:/www.typophile.com/node/30322 "Go to previous forum topic") [Religional Question Answering Institute Logo ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828002634/http:/www.typophile.com/node/30193 "Go to next forum topic")
author: chillypepper

comments.content:
Kyle,

first impression: this is lovely - playful & silly yet very professional. Somewhat reminding me of the Marx Brothers (don’t ask why...).

The 2 face illustration is working nicely too (great color choices), but i would detach it from the type as i gets a little hectic. Maybe try placing it on top or to the left of the type.  
Anyway, well done!

Seb

I like too, not sure I agree so much with Seb and the detachment idea. I do however don’t care much for the transparency on the lighter orange fellow (Haph, I presume). Make him a solid color. Also, the black is a bit over-powering, perhaps a dark gray or darker orange, or even a complimentary blue?

All in all, very well done.
I like this a lot as well. The only thing I might suggest is either use gray or don’t use gray. I would not use gray as the black really makes those oranges pop.
Grey with e not a Miss Tiffany :)

I’m loving it but why is the little guy in 2 two colours. I mean his nose is half yellow, half orange. As Asvetic said make hima solid colour too like the other fellow. I think if he was solid yellow, it owuld be better. When I mean yellow, i mean the colour that’s projecting onto big guy. I liek it tho and the type with the grey shadow works better for me. Up to you though.
Gray is ’merican. ;^) Apologies, of course I meant to use ’grey’.

<cite>Grey with e not a Miss Tiffany :)</cite>

They finally pay back the war debt and go right back to treating us like colonists...

I like both logos, but I think that the second might be overkill at times. I’d like to see the first logo in black with the & in another color. If you do go with the second, I think that the others are right and the second face should be a solid to keep things simple.
Sorry Miss Tiffany :D I obviously was not aware of that. We learn new things everyday I guess, :D
Are you sure about the lower end of Haäfe’s throat (or chin?)? Together with the – ahm, distinct – style of the noses?

I love the letters, they remind me of the unabashed positivity in the ink work of great American animators of the 50-60’s. Something like “I’m so capable that when I play, it still looks great.”

I imagine that if you search, theres a way to form the portraits into an ampersand form, which would give you the best of both logotypes in one?

Stephan has a good point about the ...anatomy?

[Choz Cunningham](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828002634/http:/www.chozcunningham.com/)  
 [!Exclamachine Type Foundry](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828002634/http:/www.exclamachine.com/)  
 [The Snark](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828002634/http:/www.exclamachine.com/snark)

<cite>Are you sure about the lower end of Haäfe’s throat (or chin?)? Together with the – ahm, distinct – style of the noses?</cite>

<cite>Stephan has a good point about the …anatomy?</cite>

Beauty is in the eye of the beholder?
yeah.. I did kinda notice the somewhat phallic resemblance. I think I’ll work on a new nose/chin :)

The nose and chin are fine. Some people can find anatomy in anything.

- Lex
